listing.description: ****extended detached property****This fantastic detached home is perfectly located being just a short walk from Kingsway shops as well as within easy walking distance of the town centre. Rugby train station is a twenty minute walk with it's high speed links to London Euston and there is easy access to M1/M6 motorways. Situated in this part of Dunchurch Road you are in the catchment areas for several well regarded primary and secondary schools.The property has been greatly extended over recent years and offers spacious and versatile accommodation. There is the potential to adapt part of the ground floor to give almost self contained living for an elderly or disabled person or simply the ability to use any of the ground floor reception rooms as additional bedrooms for a large family or individuals working from home needing office space.In brief the accommodation to the ground floor comprises: Large entrance hall, spacious lounge with wood burning stove and feature built in aquarium, breakfast kitchen, wet room, family bathroom and three additional good sized reception rooms which can be used as required. To the first floor is a master bedroom with ensuite, three further double bedrooms and second family bathroom.Externally the property has a graveled driveway accessed through wrought iron double gates providing parking for several cars and direct access to a detached double garage. The rear garden is enclosed and mainly laid to lawn, has a paved patio and seating area and there is an additional decked area to the side of the property.Internal viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the fantastic and versatile space this home has to offer.

listing.description: Luxury on a grand scale this beautiful home looks great from all directions and is suitable for a wide range of buyers! Immaculately presented throughout with so many plus points including the two large En-suites, huge living kitchen with island unit and bay with french doors leading out to the immaculately groomed gardens to rear! And that's before we mention the highly sought after location in close proximity to the centre of this delightful village with its excellent schools! Accommodation comprises hall, cloakroom/WC, lounge, dining room, living kitchen, utility room, landing, master bedroom, walk in dressing room, En-suite, bedroom two, En-suite, two further bedrooms and family bathroom. Externally the property has a drive to front with single garage beyond and beautiful split level garden to rear. Viewing is strongly recommended! The village offers a small library, two infant schools, the first Britannia Scout group, two junior schools and a secondary school. It also holds its popular farmers market on the first Saturday of every month. listing.description: Trinity House offers a rare opportunity to purchase a lovely townhouse in the heart of Rugby town centre. It is situated in a sought-after residential area and is within walking distance of all the amenities Rugby has to offer. The property is extremely attractive and offers four bedroom detached accommodation, off-road parking and garaging.LocationThe property is located in the heart of Rugby town centre in a sought-after residential area. It is within walking distance of all the amenities the town has to offer including an extensive range of restaurants, bars, leisure and shopping facilities including an independent quarter. There is an impressive range of state and private schooling available in Rugby and the surrounding area including Bilton Grange Preparatory School, Rugby High School for Girls, Lawrence Sheriff for Boys, Princethorpe College and, of course, the world renowned Rugby School which is just a stone’s throw from the property.Rugby also has a main line train station where Virgin trains offer a frequent service to Euston in under 50 minutes. From Rugby there is easy access to the extensive motorway networks surrounding Warwickshire including the A45, A5, A14, M1 and the M6.Ground FloorFrom the entrance hall, stairs rise to the first floor and a door gives access to a staircase down to the cellar. The sitting room is a lovely spacious and airy room with a bay window to the front. The centrepiece of the room is the fireplace which houses a recently re-fitted gas stove. There is an attractive dining room with a further original fireplace and a breakfast room leading through to a well-equipped galley kitchen. There is also a conservatory overlooking the rear courtyard, and a downstairs WC.First FloorOn the first floor, there are four double bedrooms which are all of a good size. The master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and the other bedrooms have use of the family bathroom.OutsideOutside, to the front of the property, there is a small brick retaining wall. To the side of the property is a driveway, part of which is in the ownership of Trinity House, providing vehicular access to the garage as well as off-road parking. From the driveway there is also gated pedestrian access to a courtyard garden which is situated to the rear of the property. The courtyard garden provides a very private and comfortable outside sitting area.ViewingStrictly by prior appointment via the selling agents. Contact .ServicesNone of the services have been tested and purchasers should note that it is their specific responsibility to make their own enquiries of the appropriate authorities as to the location, adequacy and availability of mains water, electricity, gas and drainage services.Fixtures And FittingsOnly those items in the nature of fixtures and fittings mentioned in these particulars are included in the sale. Other items are specifically excluded. None of the appliances have been tested by the agents and they are not certified or warranted in any way.Local AuthorityRugby Borough Council. Tel:Council TaxBand - FImportant InformationEvery care has been taken with the preparation of these Sales Particulars, but complete accuracy cannot be guaranteed. In all cases, buyers should verify matters for themselves. Where property alterations have been undertaken buyers should check that relevant permissions have been obtained. If there is any point, which is of particular importance let us know and we will verify it for you. These particulars do not constitute a contract or part of a contract. All measurements are approximate. The fixtures, fittings, services and appliances have not been tested and therefore no guarantee can be given that they are in working order. Photographs are provided for general information and it cannot be inferred that any item shown is included in the sale. Plans are provided for general guidance and are not to scale.
listing.short_description:
Trinity House offers a rare opportunity to purchase a lovely townhouse in the heart of Rugby town centre. It is situated in a sought-after residential area and is within walking distance of all the amenities Rugby has to offer. The property is extremely attractive and offers four bedroom detached accommodation, off-road parking and garaging.

Location

The property is located in the heart of Rugby town centre in a sought-after residential area. It is within walking distance of all the amenities the town has to offer including an extensive range of restaurants, bars, leisure and shopping facilities including an independent quarter. There is an impressive range of state and private schooling available in Rugby and the surrounding area including Bilton Grange Preparatory School, Rugby High School for Girls, Lawrence Sheriff for Boys, Princethorpe College and, of course, the world renowned Rugby School which is just a stone’s throw from the property. Rugby also has a main line train station where Virgin trains offer a frequent service to Euston in under 50 minutes. From Rugby there is easy access to the extensive motorway networks surrounding Warwickshire including the A45, A5, A14, M1 and the M6.

Ground Floor

From the entrance hall, stairs rise to the first floor and a door gives access to a staircase down to the cellar. The sitting room is a lovely spacious and airy room with a bay window to the front. The centrepiece of the room is the fireplace which houses a recently re-fitted gas stove. There is an attractive dining room with a further original fireplace and a breakfast room leading through to a well-equipped galley kitchen. There is also a conservatory overlooking the rear courtyard, and a downstairs WC.

First Floor

On the first floor, there are four double bedrooms which are all of a good size. The master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and the other bedrooms have use of the family bathroom.

Outside

Outside, to the front of the property, there is a small brick retaining wall. To the side of the property is a driveway, part of which is in the ownership of Trinity House, providing vehicular access to the garage as well as off-road parking. From the driveway there is also gated pedestrian access to a courtyard garden which is situated to the rear of the property. The courtyard garden provides a very private and comfortable outside sitting area.

Viewing

Strictly by prior appointment via the selling agents. Contact .

Services

None of the services have been tested and purchasers should note that it is their specific responsibility to make their own enquiries of the appropriate authorities as to the location, adequacy and availability of mains water, electricity, gas and drainage services.

Fixtures And Fittings

Only those items in the nature of fixtures and fittings mentioned in these particulars are included in the sale. Other items are specifically excluded. None of the appliances have been tested by the agents and they are not certified or warranted in any way.

listing.description: A stunning four double bedroomed detached family home, with rear views over open fields, situated in the heart of one of Warwickshire's most sought after villages.The house benefits from under floor heating downstairs and gas-fired central heating upstairs. Accommodation includes: Entrance hall to lounge, cloakroom, access directly to the garage, kitchen/dining room/snug area and a Utility leading out to the side of the property with stairs leading to the first floor bedrooms, two having en-suites and a family bathroom. Shared driveway leading to a single integral garage, and additional parking for several vehicles.Location - Easenhall is a particularly attractive and sought-after village, situated around 4.5 miles to the North West of Rugby and approx. 6 miles to Coventry.The village has a community hall, the renowned Golden Lion Hotel and Restaurant and access to stunning countryside at your doorstep. There is a school bus pick up and drop off to The Revel Primary School in the nearby village of Monks Kirby and many Rugby Secondary Schools along Main Street.Day-to-day shopping facilities can be found approximately 2 miles away in Brinklow, 6 miles to The Warwickshire Shopping Centre in Coventry, and at Elliott Fields and Juntion 1 Retail Park.Easenhall's central position provides excellent access to the M1, M6, M69, A5, A45 and A14. With a Virgin Train service from Rugby arriving in Euston London in well under one hour.The home should be occupied by an Approved Person who can demonstrate an established connection to the Parish of Easenhall and surrouding parishes. Call for more information.There is easy access to The University Hospital Coventry at just 7.8 miles away and Rugby St Cross Hospital being just 5.1 miles.This bespoke property will be built around Spring 2018 so now is the time to think about putting your property on the market in time to choose your very own kitchen and bathrooms and move in to your perfect new home.

listing.description: An opportunity to purchase a Five bedroom Detached Property in the Sought after area of Binley Woods.This property has been well maintained throughout. Benefiting from a large entrance hall, lounge with log burner, dining room, play room/study, fitted kitchen with utility and downstairs shower room. The landing on the first floor is beautiful and leads to 5 bedrooms, 2 with en-suites and an amazing family bathroom with an extra large bath. listing.short_description:
A rare opportunity to acquire a 1950's style detached home situated in a most sought after South Coventry location, enjoying extensive rear gardens with views directly towards the War Memorial Park. The accommodation on offer requires general modernisation and updating though offers excellent potential with an early inspection recommended. The property may prove to be ideal for further extension (subject to necessary planning consents/regulations) and has the benefit of an in and out drive, and a good sized side garage. Armorial road can be accessed via either the Leamington Road or Styvechale Croft and is therefore particularly well placed for access for an extensive range of day to day amenities including local shops, schools, public transport routes and the War Memorial Park. The Coventry town centre and railway station are also considered to be situated within reasonable walking distance. In greater detail, the accommodation which incorporates gas fired central heating and double glazing (where specified), is arranged over two floors and comprises as follows.

Ground Floor

Canopy Porch

Stout timber panelled door leading to inner porch with glazed door and side screens leading to;

Entrance Hall

With skirting level central heating radiator, under stairs storage cupboard, coving to ceiling, fitted vanity mirror. Panelled doors then lead off to:

Spacious Lounge (24' x 12' (7.32m x 3.66m))

With double glazed window and roller blind to front, skirting level central heating radiator, briquette style fireplace feature with hearth, coving to ceiling, wall light points, double glazed patio door with vertical blinds leading to rear garden.

Dining Room (16' x 12' (4.88m x 3.66m))

With double glazed window and Louvred blind, skirting level central heating radiator, coving to ceiling, wall light points, fire place feature. Serving hatch to kitchen.

Kitchen (17'3" x 11'5" (5.26m x 3.48m))

With double glazed window and louvred blind to rear, additional side window, two central heating radiators, terrazzo style tile flooring, double drainer sink unit with mixer tap and cupboards below, additional matching base units and wall cupboards, part wall tiling, floor standing gas fired central heating boiler. Useful shelved pantry, panelled door leading to rear lobby area.

A dog leg style staircase with halve landing and double glazed window to front rises from the entrance hall to:

First Floor Landing

With double glazed window, fitted vanity mirror, coving to ceiling, central heating radiator and panelled doors lead off to:

Bedroom 1 Rear (12' x 11'6 (3.66m x 3.51m))

With double glazed window, and louvred blind, central heating radiator, two double door wardrobes with hanging rails, shelving and cupboards above.

Bedroom 2 Rear (12' x 11' (3.66m x 3.35m))

With double glazed window and louvred blind, central heating radiator, double door wardrobe/storage cupboard with draws and shelving, additional free standing wardrobe unit.

Bedroom 3 Rear (10'2" x 9'4" (3.10m x 2.84m))

With double glazed window and louvred blind, central heating radiator, built in double door wardrobe.

Bedroom 4 Front (12' x 5'8" (3.66m x 1.73m))

With double glazed window, central heating radiator.

Spacious Bathroom (11'4" x 7'1" (3.45m x 2.16m))

With double glazed window and roller blind, coloured suite comprising of low flush WC. Inset wash hand basin with cupboards and drawers below. Vanity mirror fitted above, part sunken style bath with twin hand grips, mixer tap, Mira electric shower and splash screen fitted above, contrasting wall tiling, central heating radiator, Dimplex electric fan heater, twin door access to useful airing/storage cupboard, housing insulated water tank with emersion heater. Inset spot lighting to ceiling.

Outside Front

The property has the benefit of twin dropped kerbs, providing access to a crescent shaped mainly paved in and out drive, incorporating mature evergreen trees and raised flower beds/borders. Direct access then leads to:

Side Garage

With up and over door being approx. 22'5" in length, electric lighting, water supply point, storage shelving, power points, side window, rear shed area, and sliding door leading to:

Side Lean-To Area

With panelled and glazed doors providing pedestrian access to front and rear gardens and access to a further recessed area housing a large shelved storage cupboard and a separate WC with low flush suite and electric fan heater and window.

Rear Garden

Incorporating a large paved patio area, and extensive shaped lawns with flower beds and borders, paved pathway leading to the rear, with views directly towards Coventry War Memorial park playing fields, garden further incorporates a greenhouse.

Viewing Arrangements

Strictly by arrangement through Loveitts Coventry office 29 Warwick Row, Coventry. CV1 1DY Tel: Email:

Cv19926

Issue 001

As the sellers agent we are not surveyors or conveyancing experts and as such we cannot and do not comment on the condition of the property or issues relating to title or other legal issues that may affect this property, unless we have been made aware of such matters. Interested parties should employ their own professionals to make such enquiries before making any transactional decisions.

listing.description: A beautiful, extended four bedroom detached family home in the sought after village of Burbage, being centrally located, within walking distance to local schools, parks and amenities. This property has been finished to a high specification and boasts:- solid oak windows, doors and skirting boards throughout- large, breakfast kitchen & utility leading into a spacious family room with bi-fold doors overlooking the rear garden- study/home office- dining hall- sitting room- master bedroom wtih fitted solid, oak wardrobes and fully tiled en-suite shower room- spacious family bathroom- 3 further bedrooms- large, landscaped, picturesque, rear garden with extensive patio - perfect for entertaining- log cabin with side veranda- off road parking for up to 3 cars- cctv and alarmGround FloorEntrance to the property is at the front via a solid oak front door into a tiled porch area leading to......A spacious dining hall with two large oak picture windows to the side elevation. Featuring an easy tread oak and glass staircase with a useful under stair cupboard. Oak, partial glazed double doors lead through to a ...Sitting room located at the front of the property, with a large bay solid oak window. Featuring a wood burning stove, with an oak mantle and slate hearth.Also off the dining hall, located at the front of the property, is the Study/home office, with broadband and telephone points and window overlooking the driveway.The open plan breakfast kitchen and family room has a range of bespoke, handmade, solid oak, base and wall units, with granite worktops over and tile inset. There is a belfast sink with Quooker tap for instant boiling water. The kitchen also benefits from a Stoves range style double oven with seven ring gas hob with extractor hood over, integrated double dishwasher and space and plumbing for an American style fridge freezer.The utility room is off the breakfast kitchen with two oak fitted cupboards for further storage and granite counter top, with space and plumbing for a washing machine and tumble dryer under. The guest w.C. Is accessed off the utility room with white w.C .And hand basin.The breakfast kitchen leads to the spacious family room, perfect for entertaining, with large, oak, bi-fold doors looking and leading out onto the pituresque rear garden. Featuring LED spotlights, oak skirting and flooring, underfloor heating and t.V. Aeriel point.First FloorThe stairs lead off the dining hall onto the first floor landing. From here doors lead to...Bedroom 2 - a large double bedroom overlooking the front and side of the property. Featuring double glazed oak windows, oak door and skirting and ceiling height into the eaves.Bedroom 3 - a double bedroom overlooking the front of the property. Featuring double glazed oak windows, oak door and skirting with access to the loft space and ceiling height into the eaves.Bedroom 4 - a good sized single, with oak door and skirting and a Velux skylight.The spacious family bathroom has been refitted to a high specification, having a double ended bath with mood light and inbuilt speakers to connect to your iPod/iPad/iPhone. A walk in double shower cubicle with dual controls on the outside/inside of the cubicle. Heated towel rail and underfloor heating, LED spotlights, low level LED night lights, shaver point, porcelain tiles to floor and partial walls, built in storage cupboard housing Valiant Boiler and shelving for towels etc. And a Velux Skylight.Master bedroom - spacious master bedroom with cathedral roof, featuring floor to ceiling oak fitted wardrobes, 2 sets of oak French doors with wrought iron Juliet balconies overlooking the rear garden, oak skirting and door leading to.......En-Suite - including a walk in double shower with dual controls on the outside/inside of the cubicle, wc, his and hers hand basins housed in a double floating vanity unit. Floor to ceiling tiles, underfloor heating, heated towel rail, low level LED night lights, shaver socket, extractor fan and Velux skylight.OutsideTo the front of the property is a blockpaved and gravel driveway with ample car parking. There is access to the rear garden via the right hand side of the property through a brick arch and side gate.The larger than average rear garden is split into three areas. Comprising a landscaped, entertaining space, featuring a large granite patio area, perfect for private sunbathing and entertaining, pergola, 2 separate seating areas, log cabin & covered veranda and mature borders, leading through a covered pergola to a lawned area with fence and hedged boundaries which leads to an area which currently houses a trampoline, a mature apple tree and two sheds, but is perfect for a separate children's play area/garden room or a small allotment.The log cabin is ideal to use as a gym, teenage den or garden room with electric points and lighting. The covered side veranda attached to the log cabin also features electric points and lighting and has enough space to house a hot tub and seating area to relax and unwind.There is also an outside tap, double electric point, wall lights on rear of the property, garden lighting, CCTV and security lighting. All outside lighting/lighting to log cabin and veranda is controlled by a remote control handset.Local AreaThe property is situated on a popular road in the sought after village of Burbage.Burbage has a range of shops and amenities including a co-op late shop, hairdressers, flower shop, doctors and dentist surgeries, restaurants, takeaways and popular public houses within walking distance.The property is situated within the catchment area to Burbage Church of England Infant School, Ofsted rating (Good). For High schooling the property is within the catchment area for Hastings High School. Ofsted Rating (Outstanding)Hinckley town centre is within 3 miles, with a wider range of amenities including supermarkets, popular High street with a weekly market and the new Crescent development with bars, restaurants and cinema complex .The road links in the area make it an ideal location for commuters to the cities. With the A5, M69, M1 and M6 within easy reach.

listing.description: One of only two new five bedroom homes completed in 2017, built to an exceptional standard using reclaimed materials. This three storey home with south facing garden offers 2500 sq ft of accommodation and has the benefit of a 10 year guarantee. Situated close to an impressive range of amenities found within this thriving village the property features a large family kitchen and garden room, sitting room with log burning stove, impressive second floor master suite, two high quality en suite shower rooms and a family bathroom. The property offers parking for four vehicles and is available with no chain.SpecificationBuilt by a local developer to an unusually high standard using reclaimed bricks, rosemary roof tiles, wooden internal doors, double glazed Benlowe windows and Portland stone sills. All bathrooms are fitted in a contemporary style with Duravit (Philippe Starck range) sanitary ware and Hansgrohe showers and taps throughout (except utility room), Karndean flooring extends throughout the hallway, kitchen, garden room and cloakroom.LocationBurbage is a thriving village on the outskirts of Hinckley town centre in west Leicestershire. The property is close to all village amenities which includes a weekly farmer’s market, annual summer fete and an impressive range of individual shops, two restaurants and four pubs. Just a short walk from the property is the Grove Road C of E primary, Junior school and Hastings High School.Leicester 12.9 miles / Hinckley 2 miles / M69 (J1) & A5 1.3 miles / Nuneaton 6.4 miles / Market Bosworth 9.2 miles / Lutterworth 9.8 milesGround FloorThe property is entered under a tiled entrance canopy into a spacious hallway with feature staircase, under stairs cupboard and cloaks/WC. Off the hallway is a study, sitting room with log burning stove set on a slate hearth and extending across the rear of the property is a large family kitchen. listing.short_description:
One of only two new five bedroom homes completed in 2017, built to an exceptional standard using reclaimed materials. This three storey home with south facing garden offers 2500 sq ft of accommodation and has the benefit of a 10 year guarantee. Situated close to an impressive range of amenities found within this thriving village the property features a large family kitchen and garden room, sitting room with log burning stove, impressive second floor master suite, two high quality en suite shower rooms and a family bathroom. The property offers parking for four vehicles and is available with no chain.

Specification

Built by a local developer to an unusually high standard using reclaimed bricks, rosemary roof tiles, wooden internal doors, double glazed Benlowe windows and Portland stone sills. All bathrooms are fitted in a contemporary style with Duravit (Philippe Starck range) sanitary ware and Hansgrohe showers and taps throughout (except utility room), Karndean flooring extends throughout the hallway, kitchen, garden room and cloakroom.

Location

Burbage is a thriving village on the outskirts of Hinckley town centre in west Leicestershire. The property is close to all village amenities which includes a weekly farmer’s market, annual summer fete and an impressive range of individual shops, two restaurants and four pubs. Just a short walk from the property is the Grove Road C of E primary, Junior school and Hastings High School. Leicester 12.9 miles / Hinckley 2 miles / M69 (J1) & A5 1.3 miles / Nuneaton 6.4 miles / Market Bosworth 9.2 miles / Lutterworth 9.8 miles

Ground Floor

The property is entered under a tiled entrance canopy into a spacious hallway with feature staircase, under stairs cupboard and cloaks/WC. Off the hallway is a study, sitting room with log burning stove set on a slate hearth and extending across the rear of the property is a large family kitchen. The kitchen is fitted with a range of bespoke cabinets, oak worktops and integrated appliances including a dual fuel Fisher & Paykel range cooker with matching extractor over, Smeg dishwasher and Fisher & Paykel American style fridge-freezer with plumbing. Open plan to the kitchen is a garden room with high vaulted ceiling, two Velux windows and French doors which open into the rear garden. A utility room with matching units, sink, oak worktops and external door to rear completes the ground floor accommodation.

First Floor

On the first floor a large landing provides access to four bedrooms and contemporary style family bathroom with wall mounted wash hand basin. Bedroom two has the benefit of a shower room with double shower with drench head shower

Second Floor

The master suite occupies almost the entire roof space on the second floor. A high vaulted ceiling and several Velux windows create a light space and high a degree of privacy. There is ample space within the master bedroom to create a dressing area and sitting area and the en suite also features a double shower with drench head and twin wash basins.

Outside

A shared area of block paving leads to four allocated parking spaces that are laid to gravel. A side gate provides pedestrian access to south facing rear gardens which are mainly laid to lawn and include a stone terrace.

Local Authority

Hinckley & Bosworth Borough Council.

Services

All mains services are available and connected. The property has gas central heating fired by a Worcester condensing boiler located in a kitchen and the hot water is provided by a pressurised water cylinder located in the utility room.

Tenure

Freehold with vacant possession upon completion.

Directions

Travelling into Burbage along the Hinckley Road (B578) continue past St. Catherine’s Parish Church located on the left hand side. Proceed through the centre of the village passing Horsepool on the right hand side and the property can be found situated on the left hand side, indentified by our for sale board.

Enjoying a generous floor plan over three storeys the flexible accommodation includes an entrance hall, downstairs cloakroom, breakfast kitchen and separate utility room, formal dining room, lounge with French doors leading to the rear garden and study. To the first floor is a guest bedroom with en-suite, three further bedrooms and family bathroom. To the second floor is a master bedroom with en-suite and a dressing room. Outside is a generous driveway for several vehicles, leading to a double garage and a rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a paved patio, hot tub, and timber cabin ideal for entertaining." Directional Notes

From the Frank Whittle roundabout continue on the dual carriageway as if travelling to Magna Park and turn right at the next roundabout onto Coventry Road and then first right onto Leaders Way and the property is on your left.

Reception Hall

A glorious reception hall with central stairs, radiator and ceramic tiled flooring that extends to all rooms on the ground floor except the lounge.

Cloak/Wc

Low level WC, Pedestal wash hand basin and radiator.

A light well fitted dining kitchen with Velux windows to the rear together with French door and window over looking the gardens.One and a half inlaid sink units with base cupboards under. Double electric oven.

Half glazed door to the side leading to the driveway and garages. Single drainer sink unit with base cupboards under housing a concealed washing machine. Wall mounted gas central heating boiler.

Window to the front and stairs rising to the second floor. Timber balustrades to the stair case.

Window to the front, radiator.

Second Floor Landing

Access to the master suite

Master Bedroom (5.99m x 3.61m (19'8" x 11'10"))

The real wow factor to this house is this stunning master bedroom suite that has windows to both front and rear, two radiators and offers massive bedroom space which sweeps around the ensuite bathroom and further into the large dressing room.

Ensuite Bathroom

Luxury ensuite bathroom with his and hers pedestal wash hand basins, double shower cubicle, panelled bath with shower attachment and low level WC. Radiator.

Dressing Room

Open plan from the master bedroom, the dressing room has a range of fitted wardrobes and airing cupboard. There is a Velux window to the front and radiator.

Outside

In our opinion this is one of the best plots on the edge of the development with a small forecourt garden to front and gated side pedestrian access to the rear gardens. Plenty of parking in front of the double garages allowing for four cars to park in tandem.

Garage (5.35m x 5.19m (17'7" x 17'0"))

Two up and over doors to the front. Courtesy door to the rear gardens. Light and power connected and overhead storage in the roof eaves.

Rear Gardens

The current owners have set the garden area up for outside living with a lovely dark textured quality patio that runs the full width of the property with a deep area for garden dining adjacent to the kitchen and lounge French doors and an area currently housing a hot tub that is available by separate negotiations. For those of you that are looking for a "Man cave" or home office... Read on.

This is a quality bespoke structure made of English Cedar, insulated and with light power and electric heating and two sets of sliding patio doors and the lovely textured patio covering extends into the room. A real plus as a home office or teen suite or just somewhere to slope off to for some quiet time.

listing.description: A rare opportunity to acquire this individually designed contemporary five bedroom detached dormer bungalow set in a 1/3 acre plot with lapsed planning permission to extend. The property is accessed via an electric gate to a drive which has been block paved. Inside the spacious layout includes the open-plan lounge which runs into the dining room, offering modern living the main part of the property comprises two bedrooms downstairs, a large kitchen/family room and a large family bathroom. Upstairs there is a master bedroom and a further two single bedrooms one of which is laid out as a dressing room at present. The bungalow is surrounded by a large usable garden. Lastly to the front of the property there is parking for several vehicles along with a separate brick built double garage and utility room. With views over open fields to three sides of the property and easy access to all local amenities, transport links as well as being in an excellent school catchment area. This charming bungalow is impressive and its versatility works well. Viewings and consideration recommended.

With views over open fields to three sides of the property and easy access to all local amenities, transport links as well as being in an excellent school catchment area. This charming property is impressive and its versatility works well. Viewings and consideration recommended.

listing.description: This unique detached property originally dates back to the 1930's, but has been vastly refurbished and modernised by the current owners, to create a spacious and stylish family home across two floors.The 'L shaped' plot size is approximately 1/4 of an acre, and the rural setting is surrounded by open countryside, providing stunning field views.There are well maintained gardens to three sides, with the fourth aspect featuring a large patio/sun terrace over looking the adjoining fields. The property benefits from a detached double garage to the rear, with a single detached garage and carport/storage area to the side aspect.The generously proportioned living accommodation comprises in brief of an entrance hall, stunning open plan kitchen/diner/family room, lounge with feature wood burner, utility room and cloakroom/wc, on the ground floor.The recently refitted kitchen features high gloss units with a wide range of integrated appliances including built in microwave, oven with warming tray, dishwasher, and full length fridge and freezer, as well as granite worktops to the kitchen and island units.The first floor features a landing, four bedrooms, a refitted family bathroom, en-suites to bedrooms one and two, and built in wardrobes to three bedrooms. The master bedroom boasts an impressive four piece en-suite with built in bath, and walk in shower.The property further benefits from double glazing and oil fired central heating.Located in the village of Harborough Magna, the town of Rugby with its wide range of shops, retail parks, and other amenities is a short drive away, and Rugby train station offers a direct 52 minute commute to London Euston.This property offers ready to move into accommodation, which would ideally suit families, and viewing is essential to fully appreciate all that this property has to offer.Ground FloorEntrance HallLounge L:15'10'' x W:11'5''Dining Area L:15'10'' x W:9'10''Kitchen/Family Room L:29'8'' x W:16'10''Utility L:6'3'' x W:8''Cloakroom/WCFirst FloorLandingBedroom One L:19'6'' x W:16'11''En-SuiteBedroom Two L:15'8'' x W:10'9''En-SuiteBedroom Three L:10'1'' x W:12'1''Bedroom Four L:8'6'' x W:8'9''Bathroom

listing.description: Viewing is essential on this pristine, spacious family home. Set in the highly desirable Westwood Heath area the property boasts exclusivity set on a private drive with a small selection of premium properties. Located within a stones-throw of bus routes to Coventry city, walking distance to the train station, fantastic links to the University of Warwick and in close proximity to a host of local amenities this property offers convenience, all in an exclusive semi-rural environment with absolutely stunning field views to the rear of the property.Entrance into the property leads into a large hall with plenty of space and additional storage for coats and shoes. Off the hallway is the family lounge which is spectacular in size being almost double the size of an average reception room. With patio doors leading out onto the garden, a beautiful feature fireplace and attractive bay window, this room is spacious enough to accommodate any large family’s needs.Access to the kitchen diner is also from the entrance hall. The kitchen is a generous size with built in units offering plenty of cupboard space and room for additional appliances. There is plenty of room for a family dining table and the added bonus of a separate utility room off the kitchen with space for a washing machine and a tumble dryer.Continuing on the ground floor there is the luxury of a separate dining room accessible from the kitchen and the entrance hall. This room is spacious enough to hold a large family dining table and is an ideal room for entertaining guests and for formal meals with french doors that open out into the garden.Downstairs has the added bonus of a well proportioned office with built in storage, which is a flexible space that can be versatile in its uses and a separate downstairs W/C ideal for visitors.To the first floor there is an impressive gallery landing leading off to four bedrooms, three of which are large doubles and two of which have double built in wardrobes. Three of the bedrooms offer stunning views over the countryside, you really can't put a price on waking up to this view every morning! The master bedroom is especially generous in size and has an en-suite with a shower.The family bathroom is also situated on the first floor and is larger than average with a fitted three piece suite, built in storage under the sink and the added bonus of a shower over the bath.Outside to the front, the property looks grand and inviting with a large driveway to accommodate multiple vehicles. There is the added bonus of an extensive double garage which has the potential to be converted into more living space (subject to local planning).To the rear there is a well proportioned family garden which is mainly laid to lawn with mature shrubbery boarders and has a patio area with a separate courtyard seating area perfect for family barbecues!In the agents opinion this property is a rare opportunity and has been lovingly maintained by the current owners. Internal inspection is highly advised, all viewings are strictly through yopa.EPC band: C
listing.short_description: Yopa are proud to bring to market this exceptional 4 bedroom exclusive family home offered with no chain. This is a rare opportunity to purchase a prestigious property located in the highly desirable Westwood Heath area, set on a private estate of four premium houses.

listing.description: The Close is a detached, versatile property eminently suitable for two families. In brief this property comprises of four double bedrooms each with fitted wardrobes, a family bathroom and separate shower room, two reception rooms, dining kitchen, utility room and toilet, cloakroom, conservatory and generous hall and landing. With a self contained annexe attached comprising of a large lounge area, kitchen, bathroom, storage and a loft room above suitable for a double bedroom with fitted wardrobes. The annexe is currently used as a hairdressing salon but could easily be converted back to a "Granny Flat" or a rental apartment as it was previously. It is also possible to obtain approval for any other business use. There are mature gardens to the three sides of the approximately quarter acre plot with parking for at least six cars and a detached double garage accessed from Ashbrook Rise. This property also benefits from central heating and double glazing throughout.Porch  The main entrance to the property with a door leading into the entrance hall.Entrance hall  Having stairs ascending to the first floor and doors leading to the lounge and study area. It also has a central heated radiator and a double glazed window to the front aspect.Study area 9' 7" x 8' 1" (2.94m x 2.48m) Having a central heated radiator and built in cupboards. It also has an opening leading into the kitchen/breakfast room.Dining room 13' 8" x 15' 1" (4.17m x 4.60m) Having a central heated radiator, double doors leading into the lounge and a double glazed window to the front aspect.Lounge 14' 4" x 17' 7" (4.37m x 5.38m) Having a fireplace with surround, a central heated radiator and a double glazed window the rear aspect. There are also double doors leading into the conservatory.Conservatory 9' 8" x 9' 3" (2.95m x 2.84m) Having double glazed windows covering the room looking onto the rear garden, with a door leading out.Kitchen/breakfast room 15' 5" x 9' 3" (4.72m x 2.84m) A classic kitchen style with a tiled floor, wall and base mounted units with work surfaces over, breakfast bar, sink with drainer and mixer tap, space and facilities for a cooker with extractor fan over, integrated fridge freezer with availability for further appliances, double glazed window looking onto the rear aspect, central heated radiators and door leading through to the rear lobby.Landing  An open landing with central heating radiator, double grazed window to the front aspect, stairs coming up from the ground floor, access to bedrooms, family bathroom, separate W/C and shower room.Bedroom one 14' 9" x 13' 8" (4.50m x 4.17m) Good size bedroom with double glazed windows looking onto the front and side aspect, central heating radiators, vanity unit with sink.Bedroom two 11' 1" x 13' 5" (3.38m x 4.11m) Having a central heated radiator and a double glazed window to the front aspect.Bedroom three 15' 1" x 9' 4" (4.60m x 2.87m) Bedroom three offering a central heated radiator and double glazed window facing the side aspect.Bedroom four 9' 6" x 10' 2" (2.90m x 3.12m) Having a central heated radiator and a double glazed window to the rear aspect.Shower room  Having a shower cubicle with an electric shower, pedestal hand wash basin, low level w/c and a heated towel rail.W/C  Having a low level w/c, laminate flooring and a double glazed window to the rear aspect.Bathroom 11' 1" x 11' 1" (3.38m x 3.40m) This panelled bathroom with tiled splash back areas comprises; shower cubicle, panelled corner bath, pedestal hand wash basin and low level w/c. There is also a central heated radiator, a built in airing cupboard and two double glazed windows to the rear aspect.Annexe (currently used as A hair salon)  The main entrance to the annexe is via the rear of the property. There is an opening that leads to the rear lobby.Rear lobby  Leading from the rear entrance with doors opening into the kitchen/breakfast room and rear porch. There is also an opening leading into the utility room and a built in cupboard.Utility room  Having space and plumbing for a washing machine, a double glazed window to the rear aspect and a door leading into the cloakroom.Cloakroom  Having a low level w/c, hand wash basin and a double glazed window to the rear aspect.Rear porch  Having a door leading to the side of the property and doors internally leading to the reception room and rear lobby. There is also a built in storage cupboard with a double glazed window to the rear aspect.Bathroom  This part tiled bathroom has a shower cubicle, bath, pedestal hand wash basin and low level w/c.Reception room 17' 9" x 17' 9" (5.42m x 5.42m) Currently used as a hair salon, a central heated radiator and double glazed windows to the front, side and rear aspect. There are doors leading into the bathroom and rear porch as well as an opening leading into the fitted kitchen. It also has stairs ascending to the loft room on the first floor.Fitted kitchen 7' 1" x 8' 5" (2.18m x 2.58m) Having matching wall and base mounted units with a roll top work surface over. It also has a tiled splash back, wall mounted boiler, a central heated radiator and a double glazed window to the front aspect.Loft room 18' 9" x 8' 3" (5.72m x 2.54m) Having a built in storage cupboard and two velux sky light windows to the rear aspect.Garden  This large well maintained mature garden is on a quarter of an acre plot with a patio and lawn area. There are also well presented flower and shrub borders. The garden leads from the front and all the way around the side of the property to the rear.Garage  A detached double garage with an electric up and over door as well as power and lighting.

listing.description: This very well presented large bungalow is located on a generous private plot, surrounded by its gardens and situated in the ever-popular village of Church Lawford. It offers easy access to nearby Rugby town centre and Rugby train station, as well as the regions central motorway networks. listing.short_description:
This very well presented large bungalow is located on a generous private plot, surrounded by its gardens and situated in the ever-popular village of Church Lawford. It offers easy access to nearby Rugby town centre and Rugby train station, as well as the regions central motorway networks. The plot is located opposite open fields and benefits from a large driveway which provides off-road parking for numerous vehicles and also gives access to the single garage. The large mature gardens surround all sides of the property, giving a good level of privacy and a feeling of space. In brief, the accommodation comprises: Entrance porch, hallway, lounge, kitchen/dining room, family room, utility room, family bathroom, four good sized bedrooms, with en-suite facilities to the master bedroom, The property itself further benefits from spacious and versatile living accommodation, situated on a single level, UPVC double glazing throughout, and gas fired central heating. This is a rare opportunity to acquire a unique property in a beautiful setting and viewing is highly recommended at the earliest opportunity.

Enter Via

A covered storm porch, through UPVC composite front door into:

Entrance Porch (1.85m x 1.08m (6'0" x 3'6"))

Wood effect UPVC leaded double glazed window to front elevation, tiled flooring, and door leading through to:

Hallway (1.85m x 1.08m (6'0" x 3'6"))

Access to two storage cupboards which provide ample storage space for coats, shoes, linens etc., wall mounted radiator, doors to bedrooms, kitchen and bathroom, double doors through to:

Lounge (5.41m (max) x 5.65m (max) (17'8" (max) x 18'6" (ma)

Wood effect UPVC double glazed leaded French doors to the front elevation leading onto a private patio area, feature fireplace with gas fire inset, wall mounted radiator, television points, a mixture of wall, ceiling and spotlights, and a range of power points.

Kitchen / Dining Room (9.72m x 2.76m (max) (31'10" x 9'0" (max)))

Two large wood effect UPVC double glazed leaded windows to the rear elevation and further wood effect UPVC double glazed leaded French doors leading onto rear garden. The kitchen itself comprises: A range of base-level with complementary tile effect worktop over, with separate breakfast bar. There is a fitted electric oven and grill with five ring gas hob and extractor over, fitted dishwasher, fitted fridge, large larder cupboard, one and a half bowl stainless steel sink with mixer tap over, three wall mounted radiators, television point, power points, a good sized space for dining table and chairs, and door through to:

Utility Room (2.57m 2.53m (8'5" 8'3"))

Wood effect UPVC frosted double glazed leaded window and door to rear elevation, a range of base and eye-level units, complementary worktops over, stainless steel sink and drainer, large cupboard housing the gas Worcester combination boiler, access to loft space.

Bedroom One (4.23m x 3.83m (13'10" x 12'6"))

Wood effect UPVC double glazed leaded window to side elevation, fitted double wardrobes with sliding mirrored doors, wall mounted radiator, power points, door through to:

En-Suite (1.93m (max) x 2.68m (max) (6'3" (max) x 8'9" (max))

Wood effect UPVC frosted double glazed leaded window to rear elevation, three piece bathroom suite comprising of low-level flush WC, pedestal wash hand basin, separate fully tiled shower enclosure with electric shower, wall mounted radiator.

Bedroom Two (3.67m x 2.62m (12'0" x 8'7" ))

Wood effect UPVC double glazed leaded window to side elevation, wall mounted radiator, range of power points.

Bedroom Three (4.20m x 3.67m (13'9" x 12'0"))

Wood effect double glazed leaded window to front elevation, wall mounted radiator, range of power points, television point.

Bedroom Four (2.65m x 3.66m (8'8" x 12'0"))

Wood effect double glazed leaded window to front elevation, wall mounted radiator, fitted double wardrobe with sliding doors, providing ample clothes hanging and storage space, power points, wall mounted radiator.

Family Bathroom (2.72m (narrowing to 1.69m) x 2.33m (narrowing to 0)

Wood effect frosted double glazed leaded window to rear elevation, wall mounted heated towel rail, tiled flooring, bathroom suite comprising of low-level flush WC, wash hand basin inset into vanity unit, panelled bath with electric shower over.

Outside

The property is surrounded on all sides by its gardens with a good sized private patio area to the front of the property, a large area laid to lawn, mature shrubs, trees and planting, a second patio area to the rear of the property, further gravel area providing ample storage space for bins, garden shed. The garden is enclosed to both the front and rear elevations with timber panel fencing with mature hedging to both side elevations.

Strictly by prior appointment via the selling agents. Contact .

listing.description: Stunning detached property in brinklow! Offered with no chain...Wilsons are delighted to offer for sale this five double bedroom detached property set in an exclusive cul-de-sac location in the Heart of Brinklow, with breathtaking views for miles over open countryside. The accommodation affords: Entrance hall, lounge with wood burner, living room/breakfast kitchen, downstairs cloakroom, utility room and garage. To the first floor there are four double bedrooms with a stunning balcony with space for a breakfast table overlooking the stunning rear aspect, large family bathroom and en-suite to one of the bedrooms. To the second floor there is the most stunning master bedroom with walk in dressing room leading onto an en-suite bathroom with separate double shower cubicle. The property has a landscaped south facing garden to the rear and block paved driveway to the front leading to the integral garage with electric door. Must be seen! Please call to arrange an appointment all viewings are accompanied.

Renewal Fee on a Periodic Basis - £54

Fees explained


Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Administration Fee & Referencing - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

listing.description: A five bedroom detached family property situated at the end of a cul-de-sac on a corner plot. The property was built approximately 17 years ago by Messrs Twigden Homes and is located in the popular residential area of Cawston.LocationCawston is ideally placed for commuters and popular with families owing to its ease of access to transport links, regular bus service and wide range of amenities which are located in the heart of Cawston. There is a primary school with nursery on-site and a community centre which offers a wide variety of activities and local resident functions. Cawston has plenty of open space for walks including the Cawston Greenway which is a former disused railway which has been turned into a nature and butterfly reserve. There are several children’s parks and Bilton village is within walking distance with its wider range of facilities. Primary Schooling is available at Cawston Grange Primary School with further primary schooling at Bilton Junior School and Henry Hinde School, both of which are within walking distance. There is also an impressive range of state and private schooling available in Rugby and the surrounding area including Rugby High School for Girls, Lawrence Sheriff, Bilton Grange, Princethorpe College and world famous Rugby School. London is accessible through a regular train service from Rugby to Euston which takes just under 50 minutes.Rugby Town Centre – 3 milesRugby Rail Station – 4.4 milesBilton Village – 1.3 milesLeamington Spa – 14 milesCoventry – 12.5 milesGround FloorA hallway with dog-legged staircase leads to the main reception rooms. The spacious sitting room is accessed via double doors and has a feature gas fire place set on a granite hearth. Further double doors lead to the dining room which has patio doors to the rear garden. The kitchen is accessed from both the dining room and the hall and has fitted wall and base units with space for a dining table. A further door leads to the utility which gives access to the rear. There are two useful storage cupboards in the hall and an archway leads to the study, cloakroom and family room which has further patio doors to the rear garden.First FloorFrom the spacious first floor landing there are five bedrooms and a family bathroom. The master bedroom has fitted wardrobes across one wall and a door which leads to a spacious en-suite.OutsideThe property has a large block paved drive which has parking for several vehicles in front of the double garage with up and over doors, light and power. A side gate leads to the fully enclosed rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a small patio.ViewingStrictly by prior appointment via the selling agents. Contact .ServicesNone of the services have been tested and purchasers should note that it is their specific responsibility to make their own enquiries of the appropriate authorities as to the location, adequacy and availability of mains water, electricity, gas and drainage services.Fixtures And FittingsOnly those items in the nature of fixtures and fittings mentioned in these particulars are included in the sale. A five bedroom detached family property situated at the end of a cul-de-sac on a corner plot. The property was built approximately 17 years ago by Messrs Twigden Homes and is located in the popular residential area of Cawston.

Location

Cawston is ideally placed for commuters and popular with families owing to its ease of access to transport links, regular bus service and wide range of amenities which are located in the heart of Cawston. There is a primary school with nursery on-site and a community centre which offers a wide variety of activities and local resident functions. Cawston has plenty of open space for walks including the Cawston Greenway which is a former disused railway which has been turned into a nature and butterfly reserve. There are several children’s parks and Bilton village is within walking distance with its wider range of facilities. Primary Schooling is available at Cawston Grange Primary School with further primary schooling at Bilton Junior School and Henry Hinde School, both of which are within walking distance. There is also an impressive range of state and private schooling available in Rugby and the surrounding area including Rugby High School for Girls, Lawrence Sheriff, Bilton Grange, Princethorpe College and world famous Rugby School. London is accessible through a regular train service from Rugby to Euston which takes just under 50 minutes. Rugby Town Centre – 3 miles Rugby Rail Station – 4.4 miles Bilton Village – 1.3 miles Leamington Spa – 14 miles Coventry – 12.5 miles

Ground Floor

A hallway with dog-legged staircase leads to the main reception rooms. The spacious sitting room is accessed via double doors and has a feature gas fire place set on a granite hearth. Further double doors lead to the dining room which has patio doors to the rear garden. The kitchen is accessed from both the dining room and the hall and has fitted wall and base units with space for a dining table. A further door leads to the utility which gives access to the rear. There are two useful storage cupboards in the hall and an archway leads to the study, cloakroom and family room which has further patio doors to the rear garden.

First Floor

From the spacious first floor landing there are five bedrooms and a family bathroom. The master bedroom has fitted wardrobes across one wall and a door which leads to a spacious en-suite.

Outside

The property has a large block paved drive which has parking for several vehicles in front of the double garage with up and over doors, light and power. A side gate leads to the fully enclosed rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a small patio.

Viewing

Strictly by prior appointment via the selling agents. Contact .

Services

None of the services have been tested and purchasers should note that it is their specific responsibility to make their own enquiries of the appropriate authorities as to the location, adequacy and availability of mains water, electricity, gas and drainage services.

Fixtures And Fittings

Only those items in the nature of fixtures and fittings mentioned in these particulars are included in the sale. Other items are specifically excluded. None of the appliances have been tested by the agents and they are not certified or warranted in any way.

Local Authority

Rugby Borough Council. Tel:

Council Tax

Band - tbc

Important Information

Every care has been taken with the preparation of these Sales Particulars, but complete accuracy cannot be guaranteed. In all cases, buyers should verify matters for themselves. Where property alterations have been undertaken buyers should check that relevant permissions have been obtained. If there is any point, which is of particular importance let us know and we will verify it for you. These particulars do not constitute a contract or part of a contract. All measurements are approximate. The fixtures, fittings, services and appliances have not been tested and therefore no guarantee can be given that they are in working order. Photographs are provided for general information and it cannot be inferred that any item shown is included in the sale. Plans are provided for general guidance and are not to scale.

listing.description: Locations don't come much better than this but then nor do houses! Or the newly fitted En-Suite to the master bedroom. The views from the 1st and 2nd floor windows are breathtaking and will only be fully appreciated first hand. There are various public houses, restaurants, a small supermarket an individual boutique shops.Our ViewSo many reason to love this house but to list but a few the South facing rear garden with patio area and pergola with grape vine is a real talking point! listing.description: ***immaculate executive home - five double bedrooms - three reception rooms - gorgeous kitchen / diner - study - en-suite to master - south facing landscaped rear garden - parking for several vehicles***A beautifully extended five bedroom detached executive home built by Taylor Wimpey in 2010. The property briefly comprises to the ground floor entrance hallway, three reception rooms, spacious w.C., and large modern kitchen diner. ***immaculate executive home - five double bedrooms - three reception rooms - gorgeous kitchen / diner - study - en-suite to master - south facing landscaped rear garden - parking for several vehicles***A beautifully extended five bedroom detached executive home built by Taylor Wimpey in 2010. The property briefly comprises to the ground floor entrance hallway, three reception rooms, spacious w.C., and large modern kitchen diner. To the first floor five good size bedrooms with en-suite to master, study and family bathroom. Outside parking for at least four cars, views over a green and to the rear a south facing enclosed garden with paved patio area and access to brick built garage. Viewing highly recommended. The property is located on the Banner Brook Park development on the western edge of the city near the A45, University of Warwick and Tile Hill railway station. Remainder of NHBC.

Ground Floor

Canopy Porch

Front door with opaque double glazed panels to;

With stairs leading up to the first floor, central heating radiator, alarm control box, double glazed window to the front aspect, double glazed window to rear reception room and doors to;

With two double glazed windows to the front aspect, central heating radiator, electric fire and double glazed doors to rear reception room.

With double glazed window to the front aspect, double glazed window to the side aspect and central heating radiator.

W.C.

With hand wash basin inset into vanity unit, low level w/c, ladder radiator and opaque double glazed window to the side aspect.

Under Stairs Storage Cupboard

With rail.

Kitchen / Diner (Kitchen About 1 Year Old) (22' 4'' x 11' 1'' (6.80m x 3.38m))

Comprising of a range of wall and base units with work tops over, built-in five ring Bosch gas hob with extractor over, two built-in Bosch double ovens, built-in dishwasher, stainless steel one and a half bowl sink unit with drainer and mixer tap, breakfast bar, boiler, central heating radiator, double glazed window to the rear aspect, two double glazed windows to the side aspect and double glazed doors to rear reception room. With space for a washing machine, tumble dryer and American style fridge / freezer.

Rear Reception Room (18' 9'' x 9' 7'' (5.72m x 2.91m))

With central heating radiator, double glazed windows to the rear aspect and double glazed doors to the rear garden.

First Floor

Landing

With central heating radiator and doors to;

With double glazed window to the side aspect, double glazed window to the rear aspect, built-in wardrobes and drawers, central heating radiator and door to;

En-Suite Shower Room (7' 0'' x 5' 5'' (2.13m x 1.66m))

White suite comprising shower cubicle with shower off the boiler, hand wash basin inset into vanity unit, low level w/c, ladder radiator, opaque double glazed window to the side aspect and extractor fan.

Bedroom Two (14' 11'' x 10' 1'' (4.55m x 3.07m))

With double glazed window to the front aspect and central heating radiator.

With double glazed window to the rear aspect, access to the loft space and central heating radiator.

With double glazed window to the front aspect, double glazed window to the side aspect and central heating radiator.

Bedroom Five (11' 9'' x 8' 10'' (3.57m x 2.68m) max.)

With double glazed window to the front aspect, central heating radiator and door to wardrobe.

Study (9' 7'' x 5' 9'' (2.92m x 1.74m))

With double glazed window to the rear aspect and central heating radiator.

Airing Cupboard

With hot water cylinder (Range Tribune he) and shelf.

Family Bathroom (7' 9'' x 6' 6'' (2.36m x 1.97m))

White suite comprising panelled bath, separate shower cubicle with shower off the boiler, hand wash basin inset into vanity unit, low level w/c, ladder radiator, extractor fan and opaque double glazed window to the side aspect.

Outside

Front (Overlooking A Green)

With two lawned areas, borders containing plants and shrubs, path to front door and driveway with parking for two cars and direct access to a brick built garage.

Landscaped Rear Garden (South Facing)

Laid to lawn with a paved patio area, borders containing plants and shrubs, outside lights, tap, outside power point, gate to side and door to garage.

With pitched roof, up and over door, light and power.

listing.description: 31 Leveson Crescent is a thoughtfully and substantially extended, 5 bedroom semi detached residence, requiring some modernisation and being most conveniently situated within a short strolling distance of the village centre.Overview31 Leveson Crescent is a thoughtfully and substantially extended, 5 bedroom semi detached residence, requiring some modernisation and being most conveniently situated within a short strolling distance of the village centre.Vendor CommentsWe bought this house 36 years ago having spent over six months looking at many houses throughout Balsall Common, Knowle, Dorridge and Kenilworth, many of which were detached but as soon as we saw this house, we immediately knew that this was the home for us.We had no children at the time but as our family grew, we decided to extend our property rather than to move.The rooms are large and light and our six children have always had their own bedrooms and plenty of space downstairs. The small front room has changed over the years having been used as office, bedroom, playroom and now sitting room.There is still great potential for an extended kitchen and the plumbing and electricity supply are already in place for a downstairs guest washroom but regretfully, the time has now come for us to retire and downsize.The back garden is very private and although larger than you would think, is easy to maintain. The large secluded front garden has a sweeping in and out drive and could be re-organised to provide extra parking space and perhaps a secure play area.Balsall Common has been a perfect area for bringing up our family and our home is adjacent to the Heart of England School. All local amenities are close at hand, there is an excellent bus service and Berkswell Railway Station (providing direct connections to Birmingham and London) is only a ten-minute walk away. Although Balsall Common is now a small town rather than a large Village we are surrounded by countryside providing the opportunity for walking, cycling etc.There continues to be a thriving local community and our neighbours on both sides, although having only recently moved in, are genuinely nice people with young families.Local AuthoritySolihull Borough Council

Wall mounted power points and TV aerial point for a wall mounted flatscreen TV. Inset ceiling spotlightsBedroom Three To Rear (3.62 x 2.66 (11'10" x 8'8"))With inset ceiling spotlights. Extractor fanOutsideThe property is nicely situated in a cul de sac, set well back from the road, screened behind picket fencing. A five bar gate leads to a full width stoned driveway offering ample car parking, leading to the single integral garage (15 ft 4 ins x 7 ft 9 ins) with up and over door to front. The garage has light, power and houses the wall mounted Vaillant gas condensing boiler for central heating and domestic hot water. Also the cylinder for domestic hot water. A wrought iron gate and stoned pathway leads down the left hand side of the property to the good sized fenced and enclosed rear garden which has a full width timber decked patio adjacent to the rear of the property, beyond which the garden is principally laid to lawn with surrounding well stocked beds and borders and stoned pathway. listing.description: **viewing essential** an individually designed 17 year old spacious dormer style family residence **sought after non estate burbage location**ViewingBy arrangement through the Agents.Directional NoteTravel out of Hinckley along Rugby Road, up Sketchley Hill and take the first turn right into Hillside Road. First left into Greenmoor Road and first right into Applebee Road. Follow this road along and you will see this property on the left hand side, after approximately fifty yards.DescriptionThis individually designed detached dormer style property standing on a good sized yet easy to maintain plot with ample private parking for at least four cars as well as a carport and brick built garage. listing.short_description:
**viewing essential** an individually designed 17 year old spacious dormer style family residence **sought after non estate burbage location**

Viewing

By arrangement through the Agents.

Directional Note

Travel out of Hinckley along Rugby Road, up Sketchley Hill and take the first turn right into Hillside Road. First left into Greenmoor Road and first right into Applebee Road. Follow this road along and you will see this property on the left hand side, after approximately fifty yards.

Description

This individually designed detached dormer style property standing on a good sized yet easy to maintain plot with ample private parking for at least four cars as well as a carport and brick built garage. The rear garden is easy to maintain and private with a south westerly facing aspect. The property enjoys an impressive L shaped hall with principle rooms off including an elegant lounge/dining room, recently refitted contemporary kitchen, useful dining/garden room overlooking the rear garden, two ground floor bedrooms and a modern shower room. To the first floor there is a large study landing with separate dressing room, two further bedrooms and a family bathroom. It is situated in a sought after non estate Burbage location, convenient for both Hinckley and Burbage centres with their shops, schools and amenities. Commuting via the A47, A5 and M69 junctions makes travelling to Leicester, Coventry, Birmingham and surrounding urban areas very good indeed. More specifically the well planned, gas fired centrally heated and double glazed accommodation comprises:

Entrance Hall (5.4m x 2m (17'8" x 6'6"))

Having hardwood double glazed front door and side windows, alarm control panel, central heating radiator, wall light points, built in storage cupboard and access to the roof space

Cloakroom

Having central heating radiator.

Family Bathroom (2.6m x 2m (8'6" x 6'6" ))

Having double walk in shower cubicle, pedestal wash hand basin, low level w.C., chrome ladder style heated rail, inset ceiling spot lighting, ceramic tiled splashbacks and flooring.

Study/Bedroom Four (2.7m x 2m (8'10" x 6'6"))

Having built in double wardrobe and central heating radiator.

Lounge/Dining Room (7.4m x 4.2m (24'3" x 13'9" ))

Having Georgian glazed doors off the hall, feature ornate fireplace with living flame gas fire, marble surround and hearth, tv aerial point, two central heating radiators and plaster coved ceiling.

Lounge/Dining Room

Kitchen (3.9m x 2.8m (12'9" x 9'2" ))

Having superb range of gloss white contemporary fitted units including base units, drawers and wall cupboards, quality granite effect work surfaces, ceramic tiled splashbacks and inset sink with mixer tap, built in stainless steel double oven and grill, ceramic hob with stainless steel cooker hood over, integrated washing machine, tumble dryer, dishwasher and fridge freezer, feature under lighting. Facility for wall mounted tv and hardwood rear entrance door.

Dining Room/Garden Room/Study (3.9m x 3.1m (12'9" x 10'2" ))

Having spindle balustraded staircase, designer central heating radiator, central heating radiator and double glazed patio doors opening onto the private rear garden.

Bedroom Two (3.9m x 3.8m (12'9" x 12'5" ))

Having vinyl light wood effect flooring and central heating radiator.

First Floor Study Landing (4.2m x 3m (13'9" x 9'10"))

Having spindle balustrading, built in storage drawers and spot lighting.

Walk In Eaves Storage (4.2m x 1.5m (13'9" x 4'11" ))

Having automatic lighting.

Dressing Room (2.6m x 2.2m (8'6" x 7'2"))

Having feature wood panelled walling.

Ensuite Bathroom (2.2m x 2.2m (7'2" x 7'2" ))

Having white suite including panelled bath with shower mixer, vanity unit with wash hand basin, integrated low level w.C., shaver light and point, feature panelled walling and double glazed velux roof light.

Master Bedroom (4.9m x 3.5m (16'0" x 11'5" ))

Having central heating radiator, tv aerial point and velux double glazed roof light.

Bedroom Three (4.8m x 2.2m (15'8" x 7'2" ))

Having central heating radiator.

Outside

There is direct vehicular access over a sweeping block paved driveway with standing for numerous cars. Front garden with feature shrubbery, walled and fenced boundaries. Car port with security lighting. Double doors leading to a brick built garage (6m x 2.7m) having pitched roof, gas fired boiler for central heating and domestic hot water, side personal door to garden, power and light. A fully enclosed rear garden with patio area, lawn, security lighting, cold water tap. South Westerly facing aspect.

Outside

listing.description: A spacious four bedroom detached family home built by Mssrs David Wilson. Situated at the end of a private drive with just three other properties in the popular residential area of Cawston, this beautifully presented property further benefits from a double garage and a southwest facing garden.Agent's NoteTo comply with Estate Agents Act 1979 we must inform any prospective purchasers that the vendor of this property is a member of staff from Howkins and Harrison.LocationCawston is ideally placed for commuters and is popular with families owing to its ease of access to transport links, regular bus service and wide range of amenities which are located in the heart of Cawston. There is a primary school with nursery on-site and a community centre which offers a wide variety of activities and local resident functions. Cawston has plenty of open space for walks including the Cawston Greenway, a former disused railway which has been turned into a nature and butterfly reserve. There are several children’s parks and Bilton village, with its wider range of facilities, is a short walk away. Primary Schooling is available at Cawston Grange Primary School, Bilton Junior School, and Henry Hinde School, all of which are within walking distance. There is also an impressive range of state and private schooling available in Rugby and the surrounding area, including Rugby High School for Girls, Lawrence Sheriff, Bilton Grange Preparatory Shcool, Princethorpe College and world renowned Rugby School. London is accessible through a regular train service from Rugby to Euston which takes just under 50 minutes.Rugby Town Centre – 3 milesRugby Rail Station – 4.4 milesBilton Village – 1.3 milesLeamington Spa – 14 milesCoventry – 12.5 milesGround FloorA spacious hallway with engineered oak flooring has stairs rising to the first floor and doors leading to the sitting room with feature gas fireplace with granite hearth. Double glazed doors lead to the dining room which has patio doors onto the rear garden. There is a re-fitted cloakroom with a modern white suite and further engineered oak flooring. The spacious kitchen/breakfast/family room has porcelain tiles throughout and granite work surfaces. From the kitchen, patio doors lead to the rear garden and a further door leads to the utility room with porcelain floor tiles and side access, a storage cupboard and a door leading to the integral double garage.First FloorThe galleried landing has loft access above and an airing cupboard. There is a generous sized master bedroom which has fitted wardrobes across one wall and a door to a large en-suite with double shower enclosure. Further doors lead to three more double bedrooms, each of which has fitted wardrobes. There is a family bathroom with a white suite with panelled bath and double shower enclosure.OutsideThe property is located at the end of a private drive off a cul-de-sac and has two parking spaces to the front of the double garage and further parking in front of the fore garden for at least two more vehicles. The garage has an up and over door, light and power. The front garden is mainly laid to lawn and has borders with mature shrubs and plants including a climbing honeysuckle. A side gate leads to the rear garden which is south westerly in direction and is mainly laid to lawn with a patio area, mature planting, and trees which provide screening from neighbouring properties.ViewingStrictly by prior appointment via the selling agents.
