listing.short_description:
A spacious four bedroom detached family home built by Mssrs David Wilson. Situated at the end of a private drive with just three other properties in the popular residential area of Cawston, this beautifully presented property further benefits from a double garage and a southwest facing garden.

Agent's Note

To comply with Estate Agents Act 1979 we must inform any prospective purchasers that the vendor of this property is a member of staff from Howkins and Harrison.

Location

Cawston is ideally placed for commuters and is popular with families owing to its ease of access to transport links, regular bus service and wide range of amenities which are located in the heart of Cawston. There is a primary school with nursery on-site and a community centre which offers a wide variety of activities and local resident functions. Cawston has plenty of open space for walks including the Cawston Greenway, a former disused railway which has been turned into a nature and butterfly reserve. There are several children’s parks and Bilton village, with its wider range of facilities, is a short walk away. Primary Schooling is available at Cawston Grange Primary School, Bilton Junior School, and Henry Hinde School, all of which are within walking distance. There is also an impressive range of state and private schooling available in Rugby and the surrounding area, including Rugby High School for Girls, Lawrence Sheriff, Bilton Grange Preparatory Shcool, Princethorpe College and world renowned Rugby School. London is accessible through a regular train service from Rugby to Euston which takes just under 50 minutes. Rugby Town Centre – 3 miles Rugby Rail Station – 4.4 miles Bilton Village – 1.3 miles Leamington Spa – 14 miles Coventry – 12.5 miles

Ground Floor

A spacious hallway with engineered oak flooring has stairs rising to the first floor and doors leading to the sitting room with feature gas fireplace with granite hearth. Double glazed doors lead to the dining room which has patio doors onto the rear garden. There is a re-fitted cloakroom with a modern white suite and further engineered oak flooring. The spacious kitchen/breakfast/family room has porcelain tiles throughout and granite work surfaces. From the kitchen, patio doors lead to the rear garden and a further door leads to the utility room with porcelain floor tiles and side access, a storage cupboard and a door leading to the integral double garage.

First Floor

The galleried landing has loft access above and an airing cupboard. There is a generous sized master bedroom which has fitted wardrobes across one wall and a door to a large en-suite with double shower enclosure. Further doors lead to three more double bedrooms, each of which has fitted wardrobes. There is a family bathroom with a white suite with panelled bath and double shower enclosure.

Outside

The property is located at the end of a private drive off a cul-de-sac and has two parking spaces to the front of the double garage and further parking in front of the fore garden for at least two more vehicles. The garage has an up and over door, light and power. The front garden is mainly laid to lawn and has borders with mature shrubs and plants including a climbing honeysuckle. A side gate leads to the rear garden which is south westerly in direction and is mainly laid to lawn with a patio area, mature planting, and trees which provide screening from neighbouring properties.

Viewing

Strictly by prior appointment via the selling agents. Contact .

Services

None of the services have been tested and purchasers should note that it is their specific responsibility to make their own enquiries of the appropriate authorities as to the location, adequacy and availability of mains water, electricity, gas and drainage services.

Fixtures And Fittings

Only those items in the nature of fixtures and fittings mentioned in these particulars are included in the sale. Other items are specifically excluded. None of the appliances have been tested by the agents and they are not certified or warranted in any way.

Local Authority

Rugby Borough Council. Tel: Council Tax Band - F.

Important Information

Every care has been taken with the preparation of these Sales Particulars, but complete accuracy cannot be guaranteed. In all cases, buyers should verify matters for themselves. Where property alterations have been undertaken buyers should check that relevant permissions have been obtained. If there is any point, which is of particular importance let us know and we will verify it for you. These particulars do not constitute a contract or part of a contract. All measurements are approximate. The fixtures, fittings, services and appliances have not been tested and therefore no guarantee can be given that they are in working order. Photographs are provided for general information and it cannot be inferred that any item shown is included in the sale. Plans are provided for general guidance and are not to scale.

listing.description: A Grade II Listed three storey semi detached cottage situated in a popular back water location. Viewing is essential to fully appreciate the beautifully refurbished accommodation.Ground Floor Wide Canopy Porch  With quarry tiled floor.Hall  With attractive heavy timber entrance door, double glazed window, single panel radiator, and dog-leg staircase to the first floor with cupboard under. Beamed ceiling and timber framed wall.Delightful Lounge  With inglenook having attractive living flame gas fired stove, quarry tiled hearth and ornamental bakers oven.Dining /Sitting Room  With double panel radiator, two double glazed windows, ornamental inglenook style fireplace with timber beam over, wood strip flooring, double glazed patio doors to the rear garden. This room is open to the:Kitchen  With built-in working surfaces, base units, wall cupboards, single drainer sink unit, space for a Range cooker, and space for a dishwasher. Wood strip flooring.Utility Room  Having wall mounted Vaillant gas combination boiler, double glazed window, single panel radiator and space for washing machine. Wood strip flooring.Second Lounge  With double glazed window to the front elevation, double panel radiator, lovely inglenook, beamed ceiling and timber framed wall. There is a door leading to dog leg staircase to the first floor, and double casement doors leading out to the patio.First Floor Landing  With double glazed window to the front elevation. Single panel radiator. The landing can be accessed by both staircases one leading from the hall and one leading from the second lounge.Bedroom 1 (Front)  With beamed ceiling, timber framed walls, double glazed window, double fronted wardrobes.En Suite Shower Room  Having shower cubicle with electric shower, low flush w.C, pedestal wash hand basin, double glazed window, single panel radiator, timber framed walls and ceiling.Bedroom 2  With double glazed window, single panel radiator, built-in wardrobe to the corner of the room and beamed ceiling.Family Bathroom  Having corner bath with telephone shower attachment, pedestal wash hand basin, low flush w.C, single panel radiator, spot lights to the ceiling, vanity shelf over the wash hand basin with mirror tiling to the wall. Extractor fan, tiled splashback behind the bath.Second Floor Landing  With eaves access, beamed ceiling, and timber framed walls.Bedroom 3  Single fronted wardrobe, double panel radiator, double glazed window and beamed ceiling.Bedroom 4  Having double glazed window, single panel radiator, feature slanted ceilings to part of the room and Velux double glazed roof window.Outside Gardens  The gardens are laid out to three sides and have distinct areas to them. Immediately adjacent to the kitchen is a sunken garden which is gravelled and has raised sandstone borders and fencing providing shelter. There are steps up to a further good sized gravelled sitting area bounded by railway sleepers, borders with plants and shrubs and a gate to the front garden. The front garden is laid out with lawn and pathway to the front elevation standing behind a sandstone wall surmounted by a Laurel hedge. The remaining side garden has a patio immediately adjacent to the second lounge with patio having pergola over, which enjoys a productive red grape vine and the patio overlooks the traditional fish pond. The garden has borders with plants and shrubs and there is a direct access driveway with five bar gate leading directly from Dial House Lane to the:Detached Garage  With up and over vehicle entrance door of breeze block concrete construction with external rendering, entrance door and light and power connected.Note:  There will not be an EPC on this property is it is a Grade II listed building and does not require one.
listing.short_description: This cottage has many original features including exposed timbers and has been beautifully improved over recent years. The accommodation offers hall, two lounges, both with inglenooks, dining room open to the kitchen, utility room, landing, four bedrooms laid out over two floors with en suite to the main bedroom and family bathroom. Outside there are delightful gardens to three sides of the property and direct access to a large garage.

Outside there is plenty of parking on the front driveway, which has direct access to the very large garage that could be converted in to extra living or office space. The private rear garden is bordered by ferns and has views of Saint Andrews Church.

To the first floor there are four well-presented bedrooms one of which has en-suite facilities, and a stylish modern bathroom. The property further benefits from gas central heating and double glazed windows throughout and an alarm system. Externally the property offers to the front, driveway and garage parking facilities and to the rear, a spacious private garden with patio area.We believe this property offers a fantastic opportunity for any buyer, with a strikingly attractive and spacious modern property, that also offers even further developmental potential with room for an extension, situated in a highly sought after town location with access to a range of services and amenities. listing.description: Beautifully presented and extended Four bedroom Detached family home featuring a large driveway to the front and stunning landscaped gardens to the rear. Built-in 1912 this property has kept a lot of its stunning original features but has also been tastefully modernized​ throughout featuring Underfloor heating in the Lounge/Diner, Extended Kitchen and Family bathroom and also benefits from a Downstairs WC, Conservatory and Ensuite shower rooms in the Master and 2nd Bedrooms. Has to be viewed to be fully appreciated.
listing.short_description: Beautifully presented and extended Four bedroom Detached family home featuring a large driveway to the front and stunning landscaped gardens to the rear.

listing.description: A fantastic opportunity to purchase this modern four bedroom detached house built by o'Flanagan Homes in 2012 on the very desirable development at Poachers Retreat, Eastern Green. This property must be viewed internally to appreciate the quality of finish and fittings it has to offer. The property is also within walking distance of local schools and amenities.Briefly the accommodation comprises of a spacious hallway leading to the lounge with feature fireplace. The main feature of the house is a beautiful kitchen/diner fitted with quality appliances which then leads you through to an extended sitting room and a utility room with space for appliances. The house also benefits from a downstairs w/c. Upstairs there are four bedrooms, the master benefiting from having an en-suite and a quality family bathroom. Outside you have a landscaped rear garden mainly laid to lawn and a single garage. The front and the side is mainly block paved providing off road parking for several vehicles. The property benefits from still being under a NHBC guarantee.Hallway (3.35m x 2.21m (11'68 x 7'03))Lounge (3.96m x 4.57m (13'39 x 15'25))Kitchen / Diner (8.23m x 3.05m (27'77 x 10'66))Utility Room (1.91m x 2.13m (6'3 x 7'88))Conservatory (3.05m x 3.10m (10'67 x 10'02))Downstairs W/C (1.22m x 1.52m (4'57 x 5'93))Master Bedroom (3.05m x 3.05m (10'33 x 10'58))En-Suite (2.13m x 1.52m (7'28 x 5'67))Bedroom 2 (2.74m x 3.96m (9'52 x 13'15))Bedroom 3 (3.02m x 2.95m (9'11 x 9'08))Bedroom 4 (3.05m x 2.74m (10'54 x 9'16))

listing.description: Offering over 2,300 sq ft of living space within this versatile detached property which offers flexible living accommodation for a granny/ family annex or for a home office. The property is currently used as one large home but does have planning permission in place to split into two separate properties (subject to the relevant guidelines). Located in the heart of the popular village of Wolvey, The Old Post Office was built in the 18th century and still utilises the character from that era but encompasses modern family needs with the space on offer. The property has been substantially extended and modernised over the years and is in excellent condition throughout with such things as a new boiler in the rear of the property, uPVC fascias and soffits, high pressure hot water system and a hard wired smoke alarms. In brief the property comprises: Entrance Hall, Two Lounges, Two Kitchens, Two Separate Entrances with separate staircases, Downstairs Shower Room and Conservatory on the Ground Floor. There are Two Landings, Five Bedrooms, En Suite and a Bathroom on the First Floor, as well as multiple loft storage spaces. Externally the property benefits from a block paved driveway, garage, garden shed with power and lighting, greenhouse, owned solar panels which generate additional income and provide electricity benefits to the property. An enclosed attractive rear garden. This property must be viewed to appreciate all that is on offer.Hallway  The main entrance is located in the middle of the property; having coving to the ceiling, doors leading to the ground floor accommodation, stairs rising to the first floor and a central heated radiator.Shower Room  Having a tiled shower cubicle, low level W/C, pedestal wash basin, double glazed opaque window to the side aspect and a chrome heated towel rail.Lounge  15' 9" x 23' 4" (4.80m x 7.10m) Having coving to the ceiling, dado rail, multi fuel burner, double glazed windows to the rear and front aspects and French doors leading to the conservatory and two central heated radiators.Conservatory  Being fully double glazed, having a pitched roof and with French doors opening to the rear garden.Rear Kitchen  8' 10" x 15' 1" (2.70m x 4.60m) Having an attractive matching range of wall and base mounted units with Tuscan solid worktop surfaces over, exposed beams, integrated dishwasher and fridge, included within the sale is a seven burner range cooker and extractor fan, ceramic one and half bowl sink with drainer and double glazed windows to both aspects as well as a tiled floor.Dining Room  8' 10" x 15' 1" (2.70m x 4.60m) Featuring oak block parquet flooring, a multi fuel burner, double glazed window to the side aspect and a central heated radiator and door through to the utility/store room.Utility room/store room  6' 8" x 13' 3" (2.04m x 4.04m) A door leading to the rear hallway.Rear Hallway  Having a door leading outside.Second Dining Room  9' 9" x 14' 9" (2.97m x 4.50m) Having oak block parquet flooring, a double glazed window to the side aspect and a central heated radiator.Second Kitchen  15' 5" x 5' 11" (4.70m x 1.80m) Having a matching range of wall and base mounted units with roll top work surfaces over, stainless steel sink with mixer tap, appliance spaces, double glazed window to the front aspect, door leading through to the garage and a central heated radiator.Second Lounge  17' 9" x 14' 9" (5.40m x 4.50m) Having coving to the ceiling, gas fire with surround, double glazed bay window to the front aspect, further double glazed window to the side aspect, door to the double glazed front porch and hallway with stairs ascending to the first floor accommodation and a central heated radiator.Front Porch  Having stairs leading to the first floor and the front door.Landing  Having doors leading to the first floor accommodation.Bedroom One  13' 1" x 14' 9" (4.00m x 4.50m) Having a double glazed window to the front aspect and a central heated radiator.En-Suite  Having an electric shower, low level W/C, pedestal wash basin, double glazed opaque window to the side aspect and a central heated radiator.Bedroom Two  15' 9" x 12' 10" (4.80m x 3.90m) Having a double glazed window to the rear aspect, range of fitted wardrobes, and a central heated radiator.Bedroom Three  10' 1" x 14' 10" (3.07m x 4.52m) Having a double glazed window to the side aspect and a central heated radiator.Bathroom  Having a panelled bath, large shower cubicle, low level W/C, pedestal wash basin, double glazed velux window and a central heated towel rail.Bedroom Four  9' 2" x 15' 1" (2.80m x 4.60m) Having a double glazed window to the side aspect and a central heated radiator.Bedroom Five  13' 9" x 10' (4.19m x 3.06m) Having coving to the ceiling, double glazed window to the rear aspect and a central heated radiator.Front Aspect  Having a block paved driveway with access to the front door and garage. Further side access to the rear of the property.Garage  14' 2" x 7' 10" (4.33m x 2.40m) Having an up and over door with power and lighting.Utility  Having a matching range of wall and base mounted units, stainless steel sink with mixer tap, double glazed window to the front aspect and a central heated radiator.Rear Garden  Having an initial patio area leading to a laid lawn area, a further area with a vegetable patch, access to a greenhouse, fencing, bushes and shrubbery to the boundaries. Also having a solid brick built shed with power and lighting, as well as garden greenhouse with water supply and electricity.About wolvey  Wolvey is a fantastic village surrounded by open countryside which has a lot on offer including many local amenities including a doctors surgery, general store with post office, three pubs and a school. There is also a bowling club, cricket club, golf course, driving range, numerous fishing lakes, playing field and a wetland nature reserve.The village of Wolvey has a thriving community and together have won a number awards and were judged Warwickshire's Best Village 2011, rewarded with Rugby in Bloom gold awards in both the Environment and Community categories in 2012,2013,2014 and 2015.

Outside the property is situated at the end of a cul-de-sac with a long drive leading to double garage, front and rear gardens. The village offers a small library, two infant schools, the first Britannia Scout group, two junior schools and a secondary school. The property also benefits from having a full ventilation and heat recovery system excellent storage space. Outside the property is situated at the end of a cul-de-sac with a long drive leading to double garage, front and rear gardens. EPC Grade C.

listing.description: An ideal house for a growing family, this six bedroom detached home offers flexible accommodation over three floors.The house is situated within the sought after Coton Park development, off junction 1 of the M6 and enjoys close proximity to a wide range of local shops, retail and leisure parks, well-regarded schools catering for all age groups and walking distance to a nature reserve. The region's central motorway networks (including the M1/M6 and M45) are easily accessible by road, and the Rugby train station offers a direct 50-minute commute to London Euston and 36 minutes to Birmingham.Ground FloorEnter through composite door into the Entrance Hall with staircase rising to first floor and useful understairs storage cupboard. Doors lead off to all rooms. There is a downstairs cloakroom with modern white suite and Utility Room with space for laundry appliances and door out to the rear garden. The Lounge is a good size with feature fireplace to provide a focal point to the room and double doors opening out to the garden. The heart of the house though is the Live in Kitchen/Dining/Sitting Room which has a ceramic tiled floor throughout with the kitchen area at the front of the house having a range of fitted base and wall cupboards with range style dual fuel cooker and stainless steel chimney extractor over. There is a central island unit providing additional storage and a useful breakfast area. The current owners have a formal dining table set up between the kitchen and sitting area and the sitting area enjoys double doors out to the garden and a vaulted ceiling.First FloorOn the first floor is the master bedroom with dressing area and ensuite bathroom benefitting from a four piece suite with separate shower cubicle. Two further double bedrooms on this floor and the built in airing cupboard.Second FloorOn the top floor are three further double bedrooms, all of which have fitted wardrobes and the guest bedroom has an ensuite shower room. There is also a family bathroom with four piece suite including separate shower cubicle.OutsideThe property has double gates to the side and parking for two vehicles in front of those. The current owners wanted more garden space and so have turfed over the driveway which means the property has gardens to the side and rear. The driveway could easily be reinstated and would provide ample off street parking leading to the double garage with twin up and over doors.

There is a well maintained rear garden with countryside views, a driveway to the front with space for multiple vehicles and a double garage with electric roller door. Must be viewed to fully appreciate the quality and layout. Energy Rating B.

There is a village school (Binley Woods Primary) located within easy walking distance.Accommodation - Walking though the front door of this fabulous four bedroom detached house is the hallway, leading off the hall is a spacious lounge/living room and the dinning room. The living room is of a good size and boasts a beautiful feature fireplace. The living room is connected through double doors to the family room. Off the family room to the rear of the property is the dining room that has patio doors that opens up to the garden area. The dining room leads to the fully fitted kitchen with well appointed appliances. From the kitchen there is also a utility with access to the garden area.Upstairs there are four good-sized bedrooms with the master bedroom having an en suite. There is also a spacious family bathroom with a corner bath and large enclosed shower.Outside - To the front of the property there is a spacious blocked paved driveway with parking for three /four cars. listing.description: Internal inspection is essential on this impressively imposing family home with outstanding kerb appeal, set on one of the largest and most secluded plots on the development. This home has a vast amount of living space which can be adapted to suit any families requirements with three reception rooms, large kitchen/diner, two W/c's, utility room, garage, 5 bedrooms, en-suite and a family bathroom. With all the added luxuries expected, the property not only offers a fantastic lifestyle inside, it is also conveniently located close to various local shops, fantastic transport links and a stones throw from local schools.Internal descriptionUpon Entrance, the property leads into a bright, airy entrance hall with beautiful solid wood flooring and under-stairs storage perfect for coats and shoes. The hallway gives access to two of the three reception rooms, the kitchen/diner and a W/C.The first modern downstairs W/C is finished to a high standard with tiled walls and floors, conveniently located by the entrance making it ideal for visitors.The third reception room is a bright, spacious room with wooden flooring. This room was originally a second garage and has been converted into much more useful living space. The room is currently used as a playroom/music room but is a fantastic size and could be used as a guest room, with the downstairs bathroom conveniently located next to it.The main family lounge also runs off the hallway and is spectacular in size with a lovely bay window letting in plenty of natural light. The lounge has a feature fireplace and french doors leading through into the dining room. This offers the choice to have both a separate family lounge and formal dining room, or to open the lounge through to the dining area, perfect for family get togethers.The formal dining room is larger than average with patio doors leading out to the rear garden. The dining room also provides access through to the lounge and kitchen.The kitchen/diner is the heart of the home with a stunning modern fitted kitchen offering built in appliances, ample cupboard space and the most beautiful bespoke granite work surface, made in Italy. There is an additional built in breakfast bar and ample space for a family dining table.Through from the kitchen is a large utility space which is in-keeping with the kitchens units and work surfaces. The utility has space for laundry appliances and a door leading to the rear garden. The second modern fitted downstairs W/C can be found leading off the utility along with the internal garage.The first floor is accessible from the entrance hall up a beautiful wooden staircase leading onto a naturally bright gallery landing which provides access to each of the five bedrooms and the family bathroom.Each bedroom is as spacious as the next and each can comfortably accommodate a double bed. The master bedroom and second bedroom are especially generous in size, with the master benefiting from built in wardrobes and a modern fitted en- suite with a walk-in shower and under floor heating.The family bathroom also has under floor heating and a modern fitted white three piece suite, with the added bonus of a shower over the bath.There is access to the sizable loft from the landing which is fully boarded and spans corner to corner of the properties footprint. This space is easily accessible via a built in ladder and offers extensive storage space or the potential to create more living space.Outside spaceThe approach to the property is via a private drive where the property occupies a substantial amount of land to the front which is laid to lawn with mature shrubbery boarders. To the front there is also a private driveway which accommodates multiple vehicles and an integrated garage with electric which is large enough to comfortably fit a car and still leave space for storage. The garage also has part-boarded loft space with a fitted ladder.The rear garden is private as it is at the end of the close with no further houses beyond. In addition the current owners have purchased an additional plot of land which almost doubles the size of the original garden! The garden is mainly laid to lawn with a patio seating area and a gate giving access to the front of the property.In the agents opinion this is a beautiful family home offering bounds of space and potential to any growing family.Viewings are strictly through the agent by appointment only.EPC Rating - C

listing.description: This immaculately presented large four/five bedroom detached property on a generously proportioned plot, situated in a peaceful cul-de-sac location, in the sought after village location of Ryton on Dunsmore. The property is centrally located for access to Leamington Spa, Coventry and Rugby as well as easy links to the major road networks of A45, M1, M6 & M40.Entrance is via the porch into a welcoming hallway, leading to a large spacious lounge, downstairs cloakroom or the open plan kitchen with fully fitted units and breakfast area. A separate dining area with french doors opens to the conservatory which over looks a large decked area. Upstairs are four double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes, two having en-suites, and a family bathroom, a further room offers the choice of a separate study or an extra bedroom. The property benefits from double glazing throughout.Ryton-on-Dunsmore is a village situated in the heart of the Warwickshire countryside between Coventry, Rugby and Royal Leamington Spa. It is very conveniently located for commuting to the nearby towns and cities as the A45 dual carriageway is on the doorstep.Ryton has a very well equipped Co-operative convenience store, including a 24/7 free cashpoint machine. It also features a hairdressers, two pubs, Chinese takeaway, post office (part-time within Village Hall), friendly taxi firm and the Provost Williams CofE Primary School Please note: Viewings for all properties are arranged directly on the Sellmyhome website.

The property has been improved and extended over the years and now offers fantastic living accommodation.The spacious home briefly comprises of a one of a kind entrance hall with feature window allowing plenty of natural light flood the home, cloakroom W.C, spacious lounge, separate fitted kitchen with a range of wall and base mounted mahogany style units including a Leisure range cooker with integrated appliances to include fridge/freezer, washing machine, tumble dryer and space for dishwasher.
